title: More effective logic is needed to handle disk sorting when there is a border value for the number of rows
OB: When performing disk sorting on 40000 rows of data and configuring the program to process data that is less than 40000: 1.
SR: When performing disk sorting on 40000 rows of data and configuring the program to process data that is less than 40000, the following steps are expected: 1. Save the data to a temporary file. 2. Load the data from the file into memory. 3. Perform the sorting operation on the data. 4. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file. 5.
